user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_deinit:
```c
static int lfs_deinit(lfs_t *lfs) {
    // free allocated memory
    if (!lfs->cfg->read_buffer) {
        lfs_free(lfs->rcache.buffer);
    }

    if (!lfs->cfg->prog_buffer) {
        lfs_free(lfs->pcache.buffer);
    }

    if (!lfs->cfg->lookahead_buffer) {
        lfs_free(lfs->lookahead.buffer);
    }

    return 0;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (!lfs->cfg->prog_buffer) {
        lfs_free(lfs->pcache.buffer);
    }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: Not violated in general: the if-body is executed when lfs->cfg->prog_buffer == NULL, so it is not inherently unreachable. A Rule 2.1 violation would occur only if prog_buffer is provably always non-NULL (for example, cfg->prog_buffer is declared as an array or otherwise statically guaranteed to have a non-zero address, or is initialized to a non-NULL constant before this call), making the condition always false and the lfs_free call unreachable.
